intro: Lacaussadea, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and enigmatic flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the orchid family and is characterized by its lack of leaves, relying entirely on its roots for photosynthesis. The plant produces striking white or pale pink flowers that bloom once a year, typically in late summer. Lacaussadea thrives in wet, shaded environments such as pine flatwoods and cypress swamps.
